titleStmt.title: Whereas the Kings most excellent Maiestie, vpon information giuen to his highnesse of the infection of the plague growen and dispersed in his cities of London and Westminster, ...
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Sovereign (1603-1625 : James I)
James I, King of England, 1566-1625.

titleStmt.title: Whereas the Kings most excellent Maiestie, vpon information giuen to his highnesse of the infection of the plague growen and dispersed in his cities of London and Westminster, ...
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Sovereign (1603-1625 : James I)
James I, King of England, 1566-1625.

publicationStmt.publisher: By Robert Barker, printer to the Kings most excellent Maiestie.,

notesStmt.note: Title from opening lines of text.
Dated at end: Winchester the eighteenth day of October 1603, in the first yeere of our reigne of England, France, and Ireland, and the seuen and thirtieth of Scotland.
Adjourning the rest of Michaelmas term to Winchester and restricting access there; money due to the King to go to Richmond. Cf. STC.
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
